channel.title: Samples :: WebLogic Deploy Tooling
channel.description: These typical use case scenarios show you how some common configurations can be represented in the model. Customizing the Administration ServerConfigure the Administration Server using a domain model. Modeling a configured clusterA domain model with a typical configuration for a configured cluster. Modeling a WTC configurationA domain model with a typical configuration for a WebLogic Tuxedo Connector. Modeling a JDBC data sourceA domain model with a typical configuration for a JDBC data source.

item.title: Customizing the Administration Server
item.description: Configure the Administration Server using a domain model.

item.title: Modeling a configured cluster
item.description: A domain model with a typical configuration for a configured cluster.

item.title: Modeling a WTC configuration
item.description: A domain model with a typical configuration for a WebLogic Tuxedo Connector.

item.title: Modeling a JDBC data source
item.description: A domain model with a typical configuration for a JDBC data source.

item.title: Modeling a Work Manager
item.description: A domain model with a typical configuration for Work Manager.

item.title: Modeling security providers
item.description: Special handling and model semantics for WebLogic Server security configuration.

item.title: Modeling Oracle Platform Security Services
item.description: Initializing OPSS configuration as part of WebLogic domain creation.

item.title: Modeling WebLogic users, groups, roles, and policies
item.description: Establishing users, groups, global roles, and policies as part of WebLogic domain creation.

item.title: Modeling WebLogic user password credential mapping
item.description: A model for creating user password credential mappings.

item.title: Configuring Oracle Diagnostic Logging
item.description: A model for configuring Oracle Diagnostic Logging (ODL).

item.title: Configuring Oracle HTTP Server
item.description: A model for configuring Oracle HTTP Server (OHS).

item.title: Targeting server groups
item.description: Targeting server groups to managed servers and dynamic server groups to dynamic clusters.

item.title: Using WDT with WebLogic Kubernetes Operator
item.description: Using WDT with WebLogic Kubernetes Operator.
